page.title: 01LOOKING AT OUR AREA
page.content: Our area (D block) is near to Newmarket. Cheveley, which is the main village in our block is about 3\ miles from the town. Newmarket is famous for breeding and racing thoroughbred horses. In our block, there are seven stud farms which breed racehorses. Some are private-they only have mares on, and some are public-they have stallions on and they let people bring in their mares to mate. The area is mostly flat. There are two churches in our block, and a lot of the buildings are old and thatched and many are made of flint. We visited 2 main farms in the area: Hill and Hall Farm. The farms are mainly arable: they grow crops. There are quite a number of old moats in the area, and there is one in our D block, in Upend village. ---------
